队In a statement, the Pentagon said it had established a Joint Planning Cell with French military planners in Paris to identify ways the U.S. can support the effort in Mali, "including intelligence-sharing capabilities."It will also provide aerial refueling capacity for French aircraft and allow France to use U.S. cargo planes to transport troops, supplies and equipment."This is an opportunity to strengthen our partnership with France and other allies," the statement said.NATO Secretary-General Anders Fogh Rasmussen said he had assured France in a telephone call with French Foreign Minister Laurent Fabius of NATO's full support and solidarity, notably through the sharing of intelligence.Rasmussen said the crisis had the potential to destabilize the region and even further."I made clear that NATO would continue to assist Mali in its efforts to strengthen democratic governance and develop its security sector," he said in a statement.Talks began on Monday between rival groups in Mali that both claim to speak for the country's north.The National Movement for the Liberation of the Azawad, or NMLA, is representing the rebels, with the High Council for the Unity of Azawad, or HCUA, representing the pro-government armed groups that were formerly allied with the Tuareg rebels but now seek to negotiate with the Malian state.The talks, the first in nearly 15 months of crisis, are part of a French-led effort to create a political solution after Mali's president requested France send military help to oust Islamist extremists occupying Mali's northern half.The National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad, or NMLA, began its fight in January 2012 to free the north from government control.

http://www.dw-world.de/dw/article/0,,15745893,00.html 杨成益：杨成益是访谈人，许礼叔子，鲁缇等人所创建的奥肩哲艺体验工作坊《互助》的创始人。《互助》是一个资源交换社区，至今已有过3000多名成员。杨成益: 你是否颠覆了自己，不是散人，不是推人? 伍家飞: 散人, 你怎么读得这样呢? 杨成益: 就是散人，别人破裂而你打碎。 伍家飞: 不，如果讲这样，就讲成愚蠢。 杨成益: 没有过程就没有碎坏的东西。 伍家飞: 别人的过程也一定有，但我不会去问他一个人的过程, 不会去看他的过程，但是对我而言，我的过程会不会和他的过程相同。如果说这样话，我又愚蠢，聪明人会不会知道他们的过程和他人的过程一定不相同。

BMW to use Dassault Systemes softwareLuxury carmaker BMW Group on Wednesday announced the integration of Dassault Systemes CATIA design software with its 3D printing software in a bid to advance innovation in the automotive industry. The deal, part of a multi-year strategic alliance, will be instrumental in driving forward BMWs autonomous driving development strategy, it said. “The entire automotive industry can benefit from the digitalisation of vehicle development and production in the future. The use of intelligent software solutions enables faster innovation processes, shorter lead times and more individualised vehicle configurations,” said BMW AG Board of Management member Peter Schwarzenbauer in a statement. For instance, the 3D printed parts would enable the automaker to quickly validate new concepts for designs, forms and functions, and bring new innovative solutions to market faster.

The Syrian government has repeatedly denied carrying out similar attacks.Opposition figures have rejected Assad's offer of talks while his forces bomb opposition-held neighbourhoods, and called for the international community to impose an immediate no-fly zone on Syria to prevent further bloodshed.China has adopted a cautious and non-interventionist approach to the ongoing violence in Syria. On Saturday, Foreign Ministry spokesman Liu Weimin said Beijing was deeply concerned about the latest attacks, and urged the Syrian government and the opposition to resolve the crisis through dialogue."

Six years after closing its bases in Okinawa, the U.S. military is moving to resume operations here. The U.S. Naval Forces Japan Public Affairs Office has confirmed that a new unit will be deployed at Kadena Air Base in October.Kadena AB is already home to some 2,500 Marines of the 3rd Marine Expeditionary Force.The new unit to be deployed will be “Combat Logistics Regiment 35.” The Navy Public Affairs Office says 260 Marines and 50 sailors will be moved to Okinawa, making a combined total of 3,000 troops on the island.The move of CLR 35 is a result of a new plan to reorganize all units of the 3rd Marine Expeditionary Force into “Special Operations Capable Forces.”According to the military spokesperson, the CLR will be fully capable of conducting all the missions of the Marine Air Ground Task Force in Okinawa, while maintaining the ability to deploy. The 3rd Marine Expeditionary Force will become a unit that is fully equipped with all arms necessary for combat operations.Opposition to the moves is expected from Okinawans, who have objected all along to the U.S. military having any presence on the island. A spokesman for Governor Keiichi Inamine says the new plans are clearly against the will of Okinawa, while a leading member of the Okinawa Prefecture Assembly says the news is clearly contrary to the Japan-U.S. Defense Facility Special Action Committee agreement.The new CLR 35 is part of the 3rd Marine Logistics Group, 3rd Marine Expeditionary Force, Fleet Marine Forces, Pacific.Source: http://www.okinawa.us.emb-japan.go.jp/en/news/top/03-23-2.htmS.

It also is the second time that the fugitive terrorist has addressed U.S. President George Bush directly, urging him to come to Iraq to fight.A militant linked to al-Zarqawi has claimed responsibility for last week's bombing in the Iraqi city of Mosul, in which 15 U.S. soldiers were killed, as well as for several other suicide attacks that killed Iraqis.Mr. Bush says he is confident Iraqis will elect a government to replace the American-led occupation authority on schedule by January 31.But Mr. Kerry is not so optimistic. As the host of the China Global Television Network (CGTN), a member of the People's Daily Newspaper, and a member of the Communist Party of China, I had the honor and opportunity to interview and tell stories about the Chinese philanthropy, charity, and social development in China, which has been the best bridge for the Chinese culture to cross the world in the past forty years.The following is the Chinese introduction of this program. The Chinese name of the CGTN program is "China's 40 Years of Reform: The Communication of the Chinese Culture Through the Globalization." 作者：Jeremy Hainsworth,Associated Press来源：[B][B]BBC[/B][/B] 2014-02-20 20:13:25.0KYIV, Ukraine - At least 25 people have died in clashes between police and protesters in the Ukrainian capital after opposition leaders appeared to reject a deal aimed at ending the country's protracted political crisis.The Health Ministry said 25 people died in the clashes Wednesday and 241 were injured. Earlier Thursday, Ukraine's Health Ministry reported a figure of 23 dead and 219 injured.Kiev's Independence Square was covered with smoke and flames Thursday morning, and the sound of gunfire and loudspeakers made it hard to estimate how many people were on the square.The protests have been going on for more than two months, triggered by President Viktor Yanukovych's decision to freeze ties with the European Union and seek a huge bailout from Russia.Most protesters in the square fled Wednesday as police advanced in a sweep and the death toll rose after hours of fighting in and around the sprawling square.The bodies of seven anti-government protesters were seen on a sidewalk outside Kiev's Hotel Ukraine as a fight raged with riot police in the lobby and a huge fire blazed in an upper story.Police armed with water cannon and stun grenades attacked hundreds of protesters.

[01:27.74]Museums are observing Native American Heritage Month by having special exhibits and programs. [01:37.62]The exhibit at the Smithsonian's National Museum of the American Indian in Washington includes a collection of traditional and modern Indian music. […] Netzpolitik: Ein Video zu 150 Jahre Pressegesetz und die Frage, ob es nach 150 Jahren an der Zeit ist, das Pressegesetz mit Blick auf Online-Medien zu modernisieren. […]Very good piece, Andre.The legal landscape of the digital age has been shaped mainly by the lawyers of the media industry. They have not only had to deal with new digital technologies, they have also had to cope with a very fast-paced change in the habits of readers, the economics of publishing, the behaviour of journalists, and, not least, the political environment. For lawyers, adapting to that environment is a highly complex job, particularly when their clients are in crisis, which many traditional publishers are. In these circumstances, lawyers are not always able to bring their best, forward-looking, creative legal mind to bear.So while it is true that a big part of the blame for the current state of affairs lies with the lawyers, it is also true that they were dealt a difficult hand. And we have to keep in mind that this is only the beginning of a massive upheaval that will affect many industries in the same way, as they move to the digital realm. Many of them are just as poorly prepared for that upheaval as the publishing industry.It will take many years, and many lawsuits, before the legal framework of the digital era is anywhere near complete, but it will never be complete. The best we can hope for is a legal system that is flexible enough to allow for a gradual development of the law, as things evolve and become clearer, based on experience.In Europe, this will involve a delicate balancing act, as the EU and national governments continue to wrestle with the task of harmonising copyright and civil law across the union.

. The news can be found all around the world and most of the Japanese newspaper.I am currently in Japan and I am planning to take the Shinkansen to Kyoto on 04 May 2011. According to your post above, it will be the end of Golden Week (not to be confused with the upcoming Golden Week from 02 – 05 May). I am a bit worried because I may encounter a lot of people taking the train at the same time and might miss the train to Kyoto. How should I deal with the crowd? Any help would be greatly appreciated.My advice is to get to the station early. The station will be quite crowded during golden week. But getting to the station early allows you to get through the crowd and get your ticket before everyone else starts lining up. Then you can get a seat (or at least find a good spot to stand with your luggage). If you are already in Tokyo, don’t leave home with too much luggage. It’s easy to forget how crowded Tokyo stations are.When I used to take the train during holidays, I always wanted to arrive 30 minutes earlier than usual because I would sometimes spend up to 10-15 minutes just lining up for my ticket (or the IC ticket machine).Oh I see. Thanks a lot for the advice! I was so worried since this is my first time in Japan, and the first time I travel alone… haha. Really appreciate the quick response! Thanks again!Nancy, I had a feeling that you were a first timer in Japan, and I wanted to help you with your trip.

网http://mp3.cnr.cn/audio/20120531/916747841.mp3In April, the National Development and Reform Commission and the Ministry of Commerce jointly issued several directives on restricting the use of foreign-made products in the public procurement. It was then publicized by the media as the "Buy Chinese" policy. The German media were not happy about it. On the contrary, they were scared, because Germany's export to China in the first quarter was 32.7% less than the same period last year.As an export-oriented country, 40% of the German exports goes to China. When we hear "Buy Chinese," we don't just think of our loss of business in China; we worry about the entire German economy. This "China shock" has not happened, but we cannot ignore it. The fear of the German government and businesses about China's growing strength in the economy is inevitable, but it is necessary for us to understand the "Buy Chinese" policy from a different view.Germany is concerned that the "Buy Chinese" policy is another "made in China" slogan. But it is clear that this is a way to restrict the use of foreign-made products in public procurement, while it still allows companies to choose among domestic and foreign-made products. This is a policy to promote the healthy development of the domestic market, and it is not just a tool to promote "Made in China" or a "Buy Chinese" policy that favors local businesses.The "Buy Chinese" policy is beneficial to the German and European businesses. In March of this year, the State Development and Reform Commission issued the "Administrative Regulations on the Government Procurement of Domestic Products," which specifies the purchase of domestic software and IT products in government procurement. From the policy, we can see that it is also a part of China's indigenous innovation and the construction of independent core manufacturing technology and related software.

But as I watch the waves rolling, it seems to me as though a new age of happiness could still be upon us, if we could but understand the wisdom of a child.I've made this post before, to little effect, but it seems worth reminding that as I write this, people in my city are working to prepare an anti-police protest that is to happen tonight. This protest was announced on the heels of a protest earlier this week to celebrate the resignation of the city's Chief of Police, who was alleged to have committed some unspeakable act in private (see also: the resignation of the US Secretary of Defense). That protest had a turnout of about two dozen people, and was reported as peaceful. The protest scheduled for tonight was announced as "the second half of Operation 2014", and the event description states that the protest will be "peaceful, unless the police try anything."

By zhangqi on Wed, 05/08/2013 - 17:33Dear Members of the China-Europa Forum,At the end of April 2013, the 3rd China-Europa Forum has been held in Tongji University in Shanghai. The title of the Forum was “How to Respond to Climate Change? A Reappraisal of the Development Model”. More than 100 people have participated in the Forum, 37 of them came from European countries including Germany, Austria, France, Spain, Belgium, Finland, Sweden, Greece, etc. More than 20 students, who study at the School of International Relations and Public Affairs at Tongji University, also attended the Forum. Prof. Zhang Haipeng, Director of School of International Relations and Public Affairs at Tongji University, warmly welcomed all the participants.The opening session was presided by Professor Zhang Haipeng, Director of the School of International Relations and Public Affairs at Tongji University. Professor Zhang delivered the keynote speech entitled “Responding to Climate Change: Tackling Common Challenges for European Countries and China”. He pointed out that Europe and China both aim at finding ways to respond to climate change. In order to implement this aim, one needs to take into account economic growth and environmental sustainability. In order to create such a model, one needs to find a way to deal with the global market economy.

Senate Democratic leader Harry Reid said Tuesday night that he will use a legislative procedure that will allow him to push ahead with a sweeping overhaul of the nation’s health care system.Democrats plan to use a procedure that lets Reid make decisions about the legislation largely behind closed doors, away from the television cameras that would come with a debate on the Senate floor.The procedure also will limit the ability of Republicans to mount a filibuster against health care reform, which Democrats plan to complete in the next few weeks.Reid said his decision came after Republicans “made it crystal clear that they have no interest in passing a meaningful reform bill this year.”Republicans have argued, in a series of floor speeches in recent days, that they want to reform the health care system but oppose the Democrats’ version of the bill.But Reid said the Republicans’ intentions became clear after Democrats offered to hold a joint committee hearing where lawmakers from both parties would question health care experts.“This morning my staff sent an e-mail to Republican staff offering to schedule a bipartisan meeting where members of the two parties could engage in a constructive discussion about health insurance reform in front of the American people. This afternoon, we received a cursory response that offered no commitment to such a bipartisan meeting,” Reid said.Republicans’ refusal to meet with Democrats shows they are not interested in improving the Democrats’ version of the health care reform bill, he added.“Clearly, Republicans don’t want to debate the facts. Rather than have a real discussion, Republicans continue to rely on the same old scare tactics and partisan attacks,” Reid said in a statement after a Tuesday night party caucus.Sen. Mitch McConnell, the Republican minority leader, said in a statement that the Democrats’ push for health care reform “has been a legislative disaster from the beginning.”“

During the summer, police killed two black men, Alton Sterling in Baton Rouge and Philando Castile in Minnesota, prompting Black Lives Matter protests and an international conversation about race, policing, and the American criminal justice system.This conversation continues after Dallas officers Lorne Ahrens, Michael Krol, Michael J. Smith, Brent Thompson and Patrick Zamarripa were shot during a peaceful protest against police brutality on July 7. The next day, police officers Matthew Gerald, Brad Garafola, and Montrell Jackson were killed in Baton Rouge.In both instances, the shooters were military veterans. In Dallas, the shooter reportedly told negotiators that he was “upset about Black Lives Matter” and “wanted to kill white people, especially white officers,” a senior law enforcement official told CNN. In Baton Rouge, the shooter left an internet trail that indicated anger at the police shootings of Alton Sterling and Philando Castile.This post shares the perspectives of Latino people in the United States in response to these events.Protests erupted throughout cities in the United States following the fatal shootings of Alton Sterling, 37, of Baton Rouge, Louisiana, and Philando Castile, 32, of Saint Paul, Minnesota. Image by flickr user: Mobilus In Mobili. CC BY-SA 2.0.The media attention given to the shootings of Sterling, Castile and other black victims, has raised the question of how these events are reported when the victim is Latino.Today I realized how my brown body can be perceived as threatening even when I am just going to work #PhilandoCastile #AltonSterling— Yadira Almanzar (@YadiraAlmanzar) July 7, 2016NBC’s report on the recent shooting of black victims by police, for example, did not mention any of the nine Latino men shot by police in the last year.

家: 意大利Michele Rizzi(意大利)与德国Friederike Plafki(德国).The project of a piece for 8 dancers in a scenic space is born from the awareness of a need to find a way to re-establish a connection with our most profound sense of humanity. It will use various styles and languages, and the research will be based on exploring the relationship with the space, the use of breath and the body’s energy as an unstoppable flow. The research will focus on discovering the most essential parts of the human condition, on the search for what unites us all as human beings. The dancers will explore different approaches towards the human condition, to discover how each one of us has a particular sense of the world, as it is filtered by our life experiences. The piece will use Taipei, the place where it will be developed and shown, as a further point of departure, and as a place of inspiration for our research.

China's official media said on Tuesday that Google must give up any hope of re-entering the Chinese market if it cannot meet government regulators' requirements.China's official media said on Tuesday that Google must give up any hope of re-entering the Chinese market if it cannot meet government regulators' requirements. According to the Wall Street Journal, the military conference was held to discuss “China’s goal to build a stronger modern military force,” and Xi addressed this by discussing the importance of the military having a deep sense of patriotism.Xi Jinping stated that the military’s first task, and its most important task, is to remain loyal to the nation’s political party, the Chinese Communist Party. He went on to explain that a soldier’s loyalty to the Chinese Communist Party, and in turn to the nation of China, must go deeper than an “ideological” level. He demanded that every member of the Chinese military understands that they are first loyal to the political party of China, and their sense of duty must come from the fact that the Chinese Communist Party is the only thing that can “secure and develop China.”

|German police said on Monday that they had identified the murderer of a Chinese student as a young German man, and that he was now in custody. The 20-year-old was being held on charges of illegal weapons possession.German authorities on Monday said they had solved the murder of a Chinese student that had sparked fears of a racially motivated attack. The student had been stabbed to death in broad daylight in central Berlin.Police said that the 20-year-old man they had identified as the murderer was now in custody and under investigation for murder. The authorities added that he was also being charged with illegally possessing a weapon.The Chinese student, a 20-year-old man, was stabbed on Thursday on the banks of Berlin's Spree River while he was talking to his girlfriend on the phone. Berlin police told the Chinese embassy that the murder was not a hate crime.Germany's Foreign Ministry said the murder would not have an impact on bilateral relations between Berlin and Beijing.Because of the circumstances of the murder, it had initially been feared that it might have been a politically motivated crime by a member of a right-wing extremist group.The student's girlfriend, who had been talking to him on the phone when he was murdered, said that he had been speaking with a man whom he did not know before being attacked.

The new Greek government is taking shape, with some of the most prominent figures to have emerged in the anti-austerity protest movement appointed to key ministerial roles.Left-wing prime minister Alexis Tsipras appointed the prominent anti-austerity activist Yanis Varoufakis, who has likened Greece’s debt load to the “ Versailles Treaty”, to the key post of finance minister on Monday.Former energy minister Panagiotis Lafazanis, whose “I won’t pay” movement advocates not paying road tolls, utility bills, and extra property taxes introduced during the crisis, was appointed environment and energy minister.The firebrand economist Euclid Tsakalotos, who was spokesman of the protest movement Against Austerity, was named deputy foreign minister responsible for economic relations with the EU.Tsipras, whose Syriza party formed a coalition government with the right-wing Independent Greeks on Monday, has repeatedly said Greece will not cooperate with the “troika” of the EU, ECB, and IMF that oversees its bailout.The EU’s commissioner for economic affairs, Pierre Moscovici, however, stressed on Monday that Greece had undertaken commitments, and that those who took over from the Samaras administration would “have to deal with these commitments”.EU spokeswoman Annika Breidthardt on Monday called on Tsipras to find “common ground” with Greece’s international lenders, and not to “unilaterally” change the conditions of its bailout agreement.Germany’s finance minister, Wolfgang Schäuble, has also warned the Greek government to stick with the existing bailout deal, saying there was no question of any debt write-down.“

|The idea was for the students in the orchestra to learn not just music but also team spirit, discipline and responsibility. The project also encourages a sense of community and allows children to experience new cultures.A young girl in Ghana is overjoyed with the violin she's just been given. The instrument has been donated as part of the Sistema Scotland program. The violin arrived in the country, along with other instruments donated to the new project, on Tuesday.The young girl was lucky enough to be chosen as one of the first pupils to learn music through the Scottish version of Venezuela's National System of Youth and Children's Orchestras and Choirs, known as "El Sistema," which started in 1975 in the South American country and has now been copied worldwide.El Sistema Scotland is headed by James Boyd, a former pupil at a music school in England which inspired the Venezuelan project and which is now the model for the Scottish initiative. The project will initially provide violin lessons to 50 disadvantaged children in Raploch, Stirling.Funding and enthusiasmBoyd said that 40 million euros ($56 million) had been secured so far to fund the Scottish project."We will see the effect of El Sistema Scotland within a year or two," said Boyd. "The more we get together, the more we play together, the better off we all are in terms of understanding each other and working together. We're creating a new generation of musicians."Scottish First Minister Alex Salmond agreed with Boyd's views on the project."Music, culture, and creative learning is very important for young people," he told Deutsche Welle. "It helps to provide self-confidence, self-esteem and self-achievement, which is why we support the El Sistema Scotland project."Sir Roger Norrington, former musical director of the Scottish Chamber Orchestra, also welcomed the project."

上周四是在德国所有联邦州共同的一个国定假日“耶稣升天节”，又称父亲节或男人节。很多德国男人在这一天和哥儿们托着一个手拉车，车里面装满了冰凉的啤酒，尽情开怀的庆祝属于他们的节日。由于是假日，又碰上好天气，到处也可以看到一家人、朋友们成群结队的去踏青漫游、骑单车或是到餐厅吃饭、在糕饼点喝咖啡吃蛋糕，冰淇淋店也是高朋满座。有的孩子不忘在父亲节这天贴心的送给爸爸自己制作的卡片或是一个小礼物。 园地主持人杨家华给铁杆听友winter在周末举行的结婚喜庆录制了一段祝福的话。

*什么是双重危境* 美国宪法第五条修正案指出，任何人不得因同一罪行而两次遭受生命或身体的危害，也就是说不能因同一犯罪而受到两次审判，这就是人们常说的“双重危境条款”。双重危境原则植根于西方的法律制度，并且一直可以追溯到圣经的旧约世代，希伯来法律中有类似双重处罚的规定，到了希腊和罗马时代早期，双重危境原则开始形成，后来又成为英国普通法的一部份，并运用到英国在北美的殖民地。美国开国先贤在制定联邦宪法修正案时加入了有关条款。洛杉矶洛约拉法学院教授塞谬尔·皮尔斯伯里介绍了双重危境条款包括的内容：“如果审判以被告无罪释放告终，双重危境就很容易避免，因为不会出现进一步的诉讼，也不能对判决提出上诉。

1970 年和 1986 年举办过世界杯的墨西哥市奥林匹克体育场。照片来自 Flickr 用户djmfuentes (CC BY-NC 2.0)。部落格 El Universal 带我们看到民众如何在 1986 世界杯开幕式上炮轰当时的总统 Miguel de la Madrid。总统演讲中超过九万名观众愤怒叫嚣着，因为政府决定在距离 1985 年九月十九日墨西哥市大地震仅仅八个月后就主办世界杯赛事。1982 年当国际足总决定哥伦比亚不符主办资格后，墨西哥接过了主办 1986 世界杯这个担子。当时墨西哥室内五人制足球联盟的主席 Rafael Castillo 表示墨西哥只需要一桶油漆和一把刷子就够了，因为国内的当时的硬件规格只有十六年历史（为 1970 年世界杯所建造的）。国际足总在 1956 年举行高峰会以决定 1962 年世界杯的主办国。智利的体育主管 Carlos Dittborn 以精彩的演说为他的国家赢得了这项荣耀，他说：「我们什么都没有，所以我们希望做到一切。」

"今天早晨我只得了62分.今天乘车上班晚点太多,我当时已经感到有些累了。"这位小姐抱歉地说. 她是东京一家私人铁路运输公司-京浜公司的职员。自今年7月起。公司的所有员工必须每天早晨上班之前坐在电脑前对着照相机练习一下自己的微笑。 这位女公司职员表示："早上我们一般都有很多事情要做。 当我听说还要增加什么微笑练习时，我很不高兴，认为又增加了一份负担。 对这个活动开始时我很不理解。后来随着参加这个活动我发现，每天早晨微笑后，确实能够保持自己的良好情绪。现在我认为这是一个很好的项目。"

D - Vous allez bien ?- Oui, je vais bien.“Je vais à la gare.”表示：“我去火车站”。D - Où vas-tu ?W : A la gare”是一句省略句。这在口语中是常见的句式。两个人对话，使用同一个动词，常常省去答句中的动词。D: je vais, tu vas, il/elle va,Nous allons, vous allez, ils/elles vont.D :(Je vais) à la gare.Je vais, tu vas, il/elle va, nous allons, vous allez, ils/elles vont.

- 大约19%的博客在Google PageRank都有3或更高的排名。大约18%在Alexa Traffic Rank名次在3,000,000或以下。这些数据与实际情况类似。- The Indian National Interest、Digital Inspiration以及 Gauravonomics是印度最受欢迎博客的前三名，与IndiBlogger.in网站的IndiRank所演算出来的结果一致。排名总是具有争议，IndiRank也不利外，因为很多重要的印度博客都尚未在IndiBlogger.in注册。笔者认为IndiBlogger.in不该只局限于有登记的博客，而应该尽量纳入更多博客。可以从加入Amit Agarwal汇集的印度博客目录开始着手，博客作者若有兴趣，之后可以再自行编辑。如此将可以迅速解决排名公信力的问题。

开罗 — 埃及科普特基督徒与穆斯林之间的紧张关系自上星期五发生致命冲突后更加恶化。上星期五的冲突导致至少7人死亡、数十人受伤。 自从埃及主要的科普特基督教堂发生致命冲突后，埃及的基督教和穆斯林领导人呼吁各方保持冷静。 埃及总统穆尔西的办公室谴责暴力，并表示身为前穆斯林兄弟会领导人的穆尔西已致电科普特教皇塔瓦德罗斯，保证政府将保护所有埃及公民，无论是穆斯林或基督徒。 哀悼者星期天聚集在开罗的阿巴西亚大教堂，为两天前在库萨斯被杀死的四名基督教徒举行丧礼。1名穆斯林也在星期五的暴力冲突中被杀死，双方都指责对方引起冲突。

从1997年他宣布要创办爱国博物馆那天起，尼克・斯奈德的顾问就开始担心了。一 些人害怕爱国博物馆这个名称使人想到右翼保守派的偏见。可是，尼克・斯奈德则 认为这是属于主流社会的精神。他说：“因为美国主流社会存在一批核心人物，他 们认为，我们应当反映美国的本质。我们做出了牺牲，我们必须把这个国家建设成 它应该是的样子。从历史上来看，我们取得的成功大大超过了我们所犯的错误。这 一点已经被我们取得的成功以及许多人想成为美国公民的事实证明。”尼克・斯奈德想让爱国博物馆突出强调这一点。有关人员围绕爱国博物馆应当展出 哪些展品的问题进行了长时间的讨论，还对一些棘手的问题展开了详细的讨论。可 是，尼克・斯奈德和他的顾问决定，爱国博物馆刚开始不会探讨抗议活动的历史， 也不会对战时哪种行为是爱国行为做出评价。

在内罗毕的坎格米贫民区，人们在排队买水。卖水人保罗给人们的容器里放满了水，水的价格高得惊人。一桶水卖三个肯尼亚先令。约合3欧分。这是再便宜不过的价格了。因为在内罗毕的其它地方，一桶水要卖到20个先令或者更高的价格。对于每天生活费才有100个先令的许多肯尼亚居民来说，这个价格是很高的。保罗看来也难以再继续向人们提供优惠的水价。他的水是自来水公司提供的，自来水公司在不断的提高价格。他说："每次我支付帐单时，都发现水又涨价了，就像现在超市的玉米粉一样在涨价。我批发采购的水也在涨价。 " 在内罗毕，水已经成为奢侈品。经过长时间的干旱，河流干涸，水井里几乎没有水。政府对水实行了配给供应。几乎到处是每周一次供水。

在北海石油平台周围，已经有 5 个新的勘察钻井在运作。但是 RWE Dea 公司也积极地在陆地上寻找更多的油层。比如在下萨克森的吉弗恩以北大约150平方公里的范围以及在石勒苏益格 - 荷尔施泰因州普伦地区约400平方公里的大范围区域。类似这样的钻探不仅很昂贵，而且前景未卜。在德国这样的勘探成功率仅为40% 。仅仅钻井可能就要耗费近3000万欧元。此外还通常要为地震勘测耗费上千万欧元的资金。可以预料的是，原油的价格很快又会涨价到每吨600欧元以上。因此RWE Dea公司和其他能源公司在本国探寻原油时，都不会为高额的前期投入所吓倒。德里克·默舍尔总结说，尽管投资高昂，但从中期来看，这不会是一笔亏本的生意：“从这一点来看，我们可以做到效益经营。 ”由于有了新的开采技术，人们也需要考虑对现有的石油储备作重新估计。
